title: Walking Dead season 10 episode 4 teases uprising to beat The Whisperers
text:
The Whisperers reign of terror on The Walking Dead season 10 could be about to collapse if the next episode title, Silence The Whispers, is anything to go by.

In next week’s episode, the Alexandria residents are left reeling as they remain divided over The Whisperers – with Negan (Jeffrey Dean Morgan) in their sights as someone to blame.

Meanwhile, Hilltop isn’t in a much better state either, with an ‘unexpected safety issue’ threatening them even more.

The Whisperers have well and truly outstayed their welcome around the (somewhat) peaceful campsite of Alexandria, bullying them into submission and taking what they want.

Most recently, the residents had their hunting grounds taken from them as punishment for ‘crossing their territory, with Alpha (Samantha Morton) ruthless in getting what she wants for her tribe.

But with the growing rebellion against them, has Alpha gone too far this time?

The Whisperers need to watch out (Picture: AMC)

Preparing for war, others within the Alexandria compound are wanting revenge for the piking of ten of their own with Carol’s (Melissa McBride) son Henry (Matt Lintz) among the victims of the Whisperers that were beheaded with their heads placed on spikes.

All we do know is, it’s about to get complicated as the show has promised some ‘seriously crazy’ storylines that will shake up the whole of the series.

Speaking at the ACE Comic Con Midwest, Norman Reedus, who plays Daryl Dixon, teased: ‘I hope you’re excited for The Walking Dead because this season’s fricking crazy. It’s so good this season.

‘There are things that are gonna happen this season that are mind-blowing, and the sets are huge, it’s just nuts.

More: The Walking Dead The Walking Dead's Carol plagued by 'destructive behaviour' as season 10 continues The Walking Dead season 10 episode 3: Questions we have as dead character returns to show The Walking Dead star admits crew are 'freaking out about crazy season 10 storylines'

‘Everybody on our crew, who have been there for 10 years, are freaking out over this season. And they’re kinda hard to phase, ‘cause they’re there every single day, but it’s nuts.’

He dropped a major hint that something is about to go up in flames, promising a ‘flamabble’ and ‘combustible’ season.

The Walking Dead continues Sundays on AMC in the US, and Mondays on Fox in the UK.
